title: Typographer's Fist
content: I know the usual Zapf Dingbats/Zapfino/Wingdings, but does anyone know some alternate fonts with elegant/simplistic typographer’s Fists?
author: Fred Birdsall

comments.content: I’m not sure exactly what you’re looking for (these might be too stocky), but [Fakir](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720063641/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=fakir&id2=characterset) has some gorgeous fists in its ornament font.

I’m looking for a fist to accompany Warnock Pro, serif classical fist.

Fakir is too stocky, but thanks Ehague.
Think I’ve found one, probably Hoefler Text Ornaments.

For a blog post on [manicules](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720063641/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/manicule) I’ve been working on:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720063641im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/PreviewScreenSnapz001_5969.gif)
See also: Nick Sherman’s [Manicule Group on Flickr](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720063641/http:/www.flickr.com/groups/manicule/)

Thanks stephen and aricfuzz, I’ve also been looking at Fletcher’s [“the art of looking sideways”](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720063641/http:/www.dotcalmvillage.net/nowwhatzine7/bookreview.html) there is a whole dps dedicated to fists, might make a one off font of my own with one I’ve found there.

Thanks again.
